attributes.action: Tax the rich, not everyone else. End tax havens.
attributes.additional_details:
A Wealth tax on the richest 1% at a rate of 0.05% would raise £250bn a year. Instead, the government has chosen to tax the average person.

Wages have stagnated for years under Tory rule, house prices, and general living costs have risen and not at a relative rate. Now, we the people are expected to pay higher taxes for a social care scheme that costs 1/3 of the price of a test & trace app, and a 10th of the price of High Speed 2.

We need to also end tax havens that people use to not pay UK Tax
attributes.background:
A Wealth tax on the richest 1% at a rate of 0.05% would raise £250bn a year. Instead, the government has chosen to tax the average person.

The government must impose a tax raise on the super rich in Britain, and stop allowing tax havens to exist.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to raise taxes for the top 1% and end tax loopholes, but we have been unable to verify your calculation that a 0.05% wealth tax on the richest 1% would raise £250 billion a year. You also needed to be clearer with changes you wanted the Government to make to existing tax rules to end tax havens.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

For example, you could have a petition like: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332689
